body:
@orionr 
@ezyang 

So this change has two questions now
1) Do I need to move TensorTypeId to c10 at all?
2) If yes, then to_string must be removed to separate header.

1 -- I had to move TensorTypeId to solve unresolved externals problem in Windows with BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON caused by recent changes, done in c10 from pytorch/master. You can take this on your own and I revert commit, but not exporting this symbols or reverting problematic c10 changes breaks shared build in Windows.
2 -- Sure, if this movement of TensorTypeId is possible, I'll create a separate header in c10/util.

@ezyang

So this change has two questions now

  1. Do I need to move TensorTypeId to c10 at all?
  2. If yes, then to_string must be removed to separate header.

1 -- I had to move TensorTypeId to solve unresolved externals problem in Windows with BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON caused by recent changes, done in c10 from pytorch/master. You can take this on your own and I revert commit, but not exporting this symbols or reverting problematic c10 changes breaks shared build in Windows.
2 -- Sure, if this movement of TensorTypeId is possible, I'll create a separate header in c10/util.
body_text:
@orionr
@ezyang
So this change has two questions now

Do I need to move TensorTypeId to c10 at all?
If yes, then to_string must be removed to separate header.

1 -- I had to move TensorTypeId to solve unresolved externals problem in Windows with BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON caused by recent changes, done in c10 from pytorch/master. You can take this on your own and I revert commit, but not exporting this symbols or reverting problematic c10 changes breaks shared build in Windows.
2 -- Sure, if this movement of TensorTypeId is possible, I'll create a separate header in c10/util.
